title: iOS UIKit
description: Comprehensive UIKit knowledge - Views, Controllers, Auto Layout, and iOS app architecture

questions.question: What is the correct way to create a UIButton programmatically?
questions.explanation: UIButton(type: .system) is the modern way to create a system-styled button programmatically.

questions.question: Which method is called when a view controller's view appears?
questions.explanation: Both viewWillAppear (called before the view appears) and viewDidAppear (called after the view appears) are called when a view appears.

questions.question: What's the difference between frame and bounds?
options: Frame is relative to superview, bounds is relative to itself
Frame is for position, bounds is for size
questions.explanation: Frame defines a view's position and size relative to its superview, while bounds defines the view's coordinate system relative to itself.

questions.question: Which Auto Layout constraint has the highest priority by default?
questions.explanation: Required priority (1000) is the highest and must be satisfied. It's the default priority for most constraints.

questions.question: What's the purpose of the main queue in iOS?
questions.explanation: The main queue is where all UI updates and user interactions must occur. It's the only thread-safe place for UI operations.
